name: Hotel des Poetes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were directed to Hotel des Poetes by the Beziers Maison du Tourisme. We weren't disappointed. The hotel is in the centre of the city, faces onto a lovely and large municipal garden and is only a couple of minutes' walk from the railway station. Our room, on the 2nd floor, was neat, clean and had a roomy balcony terrace (albeit without a view). The price was very reasonable and, if we'd been willing to lug our bags up to the 4th floor, we could have had a room for 45 euros. The decoration is bright and cheerful and the welcome we received was very friendly. The nearby garage was perfect for storing our tandem bike (there seemed to be plenty of room for cars). We needed to leave the bike until the following afternoon; this was fine with the proprietors, who even loaned us a key to the garage since they expected to be away when we needed to collect our bike.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having now read some other reviews of the hotel, I would have to agree with some comments, e.g., there isn't a lift, the rooms are simple. However, our experience was entirely positive and we be would be quite happy to stay here again if we found ourselves in Beziers once more.
reviews.title: Good value and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading all the great reviews about this hotel I was a bit disappointed.
reviews.title: Charming and helpful service make this a little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very simple. They could have made it look nicer with very little effort.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings - Average at best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The welcome by the owner was very nice. Her husband seemed a bit miserable though. He served the breakfast in the morning and as everything seemed to be rationed and put in front of us ( like one slice of cheese each......) I didn't dare asking for a second glass of juice. Anyway........it offers all one needs, the location is great and the value for money is very good. I wouldn't want to stay for more than one night though! Beziers has a nice architecture and the view from the cathedral is stunning. Unfortunately the city looks a bit tired and the people made me hold on to my handbag a little tighter!
reviews.title: Mixed feelings regarding this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel: Our first impresion of the hotel was that it was really pleasant, clean and in a great location across from the park (and within easy walking distance from most sites/amenities). We were welcomed just inside the door by the friendly proprieter who checked us in, had a useful exchange of conversation about the area, asked whether we had any immediate needs, and showed us to our room.
reviews.title: Friendly, clean hotel in good location
A big disappointment - the hotel, the restaurants, the town
reviews.text: Room (55 Euros/night): small, basic, clean, cute, and recently renovated (in "Ikea" fashion). Bed was quite a modest size and, as it turned out, extremely hard (very uncomfortable for us causing sleepless nights). Bathroom was equally small and basic - not really for the "big and tall" amongst us - oddly enough, the shower cubicle had no door on it.
Breakfast: Did not partake considering the hefty 7 Euro price and the massive availability of nearby cafes serving good coffee and pastries/sandwiches.
reviews.title: Wonderfull

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bezier town: Overall, typical French town....picturesque, charming, expensive, most things closed on Sunday/Monday, mind the dog poo everywhere on the pavements. The townsfolk were, without exception, friendly/helpful and courteous (though our comand of the French language is good and this probably helped). There seems to be a heavy North African population in the town especially towards the river - my partner said she felt quite uncomfortable being out at night in cetain areas and would not have been comfortable walking around on her own.
reviews.title: just what you expect from a french 2* hotel, no more no less.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were backpacking for the weekend, reliant on public transport so easy access to trains/buses was important - this hotel served the purpose well.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel des Poets for a total of 5 nights while touring Languedoc last month. On each of our three separate stays in the hotel we were give different rooms and hence we saw a good sample of what the hotel has to offer. All of the rooms were spotlessly clean, very comfortable and well appointed and amply provided with towels etc.. The owner was very obliging, allowing us to store unwanted luggage for a day or two and could not do enough to help us. The location, overlooking a delightful park, is within easy walking distance of the railway station and on the end of the Allees Paul Riquet, the central boulevard of Beziers.
reviews.title: Deservedly The Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I heartily recommend the Hotel to anyone looking for a comfortable 2 star hotel in the city.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a night as we were driving through this part of France and wanted to stop off in Beziers.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, clean hotel in good location

reviews.text: We found it to be good value for money, in an attractive building and near a beautiful park in a quiet street but still in the centre of town.
reviews.title: Very poor be warned

reviews.text: After reading reviews here, we asked to stay in one of the rooms overlooking the park and it was perfect for our needs. We did not have any problems with hearing our neighbours. The rooms did not have air con but there was a fan in the room. The bathroom was small and nothing to write home about but was fine for one night. We did not have breakfast and went to a nearby cafe for coffee and a croissant instead.
reviews.title: Good value for money and well situated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wasn't sure what to expect with this hotel when we booked but it was only for one night. When we arrived our room was not ready as we were early. However, the proprietor let us leave our luggage and took them to our room when it was ready. We took the spare time to check our Bezier and have something to eat. We were pleasantly surprised with our room. The hotel is very small but the room we were given was a good size with a small ensuite. We had a room at the front of the hotel with a view overlooking the park. We found the proprietor very friendly and provided us with a local map of the town. We found Bezier a lovely French town and the people very friendly. We didn't have a lot of time but managed to get a good look around by just taking a couple of the tourist walks recommended on the tourist map. The elevation of Bezier is high so there are some lovely views of the countryside. Would definitely stay at the Hotel des Poetes again.
reviews.title: Small, friendly hotel - good value

reviews.text: The hotel is nice and the staff are very friendly. However, do keep in mind that the reception desk closes at 9pm. There is a number to call posted on the door and they will let you in, if you arrive late (I had not been advised of this before arrival). Also, be aware that there is no staircase and to get to the rooms you will need to climb narrow, steep staircases (nearly 100 steps to get to the rooms on the fourth (top) floor. The room is basic but comfortable however you may hear other doors opening/closing. The hotel is in a good location; an easy walk from the train station and across from a nice park. The city, Beziers, however, is quite rundown and dissapointing.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a dissapointing city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A week's stay in this hotel with breakfast was a blissfull respite for we Americans. Breakfast with homemade yoghurt, jam, croissant, fruit, and plenty of fresh coffee was a bargain at an extra 7 euros apiece. The park adjacent during the springtime was an added bonus.Owner and staff were eager to please making reservations and other phone calls as needed.
reviews.title: Friendly helpful staff

reviews.text: I have just returned form a 3 night stay in the hotel des poetes and what a find! This may be rated as 2 star, but the service is definitely 5 star. I have stayed in a number of 5 star hotels and the service you get from this hotel is better than most of them! The owner provides excellent advice on Beziers, the region and transport. His recommendations on local restaurants were superb! If you want a gourmet stay in a beautiful ancient city, then Beziers is the place to stay and you should definitely choose the hotel des poetes for its excellent customer service and location (the park next to it is very beautiful). I would definitely return to this hotel and happy to recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: What a gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at this excellent small hotel in late January. The owner provides an excellent standard of basic accommodation, spotless, warm and in a wonderful location. The rooms although not large offer comfortable beds, good lighting and even a flat screen tv, and are cleaned each day by very thorough helpful staff. We were given excellent recommendations for lunch, dinner and local transport. The city is small and easy to walk around, with lovely buildings, shops and restaurants. Eating out is wonderful and £15 for a three course meal offers great value. The river and canals of the Midi just a 10 minute walk are well worth seeing, the locks are amazing.
reviews.title: South of France with a difference

description: Facing the romantic "Plateau des Poetes" garden, in the heart of the city, the Hotel des Poetes, entirely renovated in a contemporary style, invites you to a very quiet, pleasant and charming stay!!
